content:
Sure, here are 10 lesser-known restaurants in Chicago that are worth checking out:

1. Mi Tocaya Antojeria: This Logan Square spot serves up a variety of authentic Mexican dishes, including ceviche, tamales, and mole.
2. The Publican: This West Loop spot serves up a variety of pork-centric dishes, including house-made charcuterie and wood-fired meats.
3. Kimski: This Bridgeport spot serves up a variety of Korean-Polish fusion dishes, including kimchi pierogi and Korean fried chicken.
4. Cellar Door Provisions: This West Town spot serves up a variety of sandwiches, charcuterie, and pickles, using locally-sourced ingredients.
5. L'Patron: This Pilsen spot serves up a variety of authentic Mexican street food, including tacos, tortas, and tamales.
6. Pacific Standard Time: This River North spot serves up a variety of seafood-focused dishes, including raw bar options and poke bowls.
7. The Angry Crab: This Bridgeport spot serves up a variety of seafood boils, including crab, shrimp, and crawfish.
8. The Duck Inn: This Bridgeport spot serves up a variety of comfort food dishes, including duck confit and foie gras poutine.
9. The Jibarito Stop: This Humboldt Park spot serves up a variety of Puerto Rican-style sandwiches, including the famous Jibarito sandwich.
10. The Budlong: This Lincoln Square spot serves up a variety of Nashville-style hot chicken sandwiches, including traditional and unique flavors.

Keep in mind that these are just a few examples of the many great lesser-known restaurants in Chicago. The city has a vibrant culinary scene with a variety of cuisines to suit different taste preferences and budgets.
